doc.after: Rome differed from Greek city states in allowing freed slaves to become citizens After manumission a slave who had belonged to a Roman citizen enjoyed not only passive freedom from ownership but active political freedom libertas including the right to vote 116 A slave who had acquired libertas was a libertus freed person feminine liberta in relation to his former master who then became his patron patronus the two parties continued to have customary and legal obligations to each other As a social class generally freed slaves were libertini though later writers used the terms libertus and libertinus interchangeably 117
